titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Northampton and Local History Collection CA.MS.00002
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Elizabeth Kates and Daniel Michelson
titlestmt.sponsor: Encoding funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-10-31 14:53:20 -0400.

change.item: This resource was modified by the ArchivesSpace Preprocessor developed by the Harvard Library (https://github.com/harvard-library/archivesspace-preprocessor)
manosca2 converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02-5c.xsl (sy2003-10-15).
Containers added and finding aid updated as part of the College Archives Survey

did.abstract: The collection includes correspondence, manuscripts, photographs, programs and other primary source materials on the history of Northampton and the surrounding area.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence, manuscripts, photographs, programs and other primary source materials on the history of Northampton and the surrounding area. The collection is arranged in alphabetical order by subject.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Northampton and Local History Collection, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-00002, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Northampton and Local History Collection was donated over a period of time to the Smith College Archives from a variety of sources.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For in-depth research pertaining to Northampton and other local history, researchers should contact Historic Northampton, Inc. and the Forbes Library, as they have a greater depth of local history collections.
The College Archives also has books relating to Northampton and surrounding towns.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: Books about Northampton in the Smith College Archives
bibliography.bibref: Bliss, Arthur Ames. Theodore Bliss, Publisher and Bookseller: A Study of Character and Life in the Middle Period of the XIX Century. Northampton Historical Society, 1914
Brown, E. Francis. Joseph Hawley: Colonial Radical. New York: Columbia University Press, 1903
Clarke, Rev. Solomon. Antiquities, Historicals and Graduates of Northampton. Northampton: Gazette Printing, 1882
Early Northampton. (pub. by the Betty Allen Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution) Springfield: F.A. Bassette Co. 1914
Edwards, William H. Timothy and Rhoda Ogden Edwards of Stockbridge Mass, and their descendants; a genealogy. Cincinatti: The Robert Clarke Co. 1903
Gere, Henry S. Reminiscences of Old Northampton: sketches of the town as it appeared from 1840-1850. [Northampton], 1902
Hawthorne, Hildegarde. Rambles in Old College Towns. New York: Dodd, Mead and Co. 1917
Historical Register and General Directory of Northampton. Northampton: Gazette Printing Co. 1875-76
Johnson, Clifton. Historic Hampshire in the Connecticut Valley; happenings in a charming old New England county from the time of the dinosaurs down to about 1900. Springfield: Milton Bradley, 1932
Knab, Frederick. 1902-1903: Northampton of Today, depicted by pen and camera. Northampton: Picturesque Publishing Company, 1902
The Meadow City's Quarter Millennial Book, a Memorial of the Celebration of the two-hundred and fiftieth anniversary of the Settlement of the town of Northampton, Massachusetts. June 5-7, 1904
The Northampton Book: Chapters from three hundred years in the life of a New England Town, 1654-1954. (pub. by the tercentenary committee) Brattleboro: Alan S. Browne, Inc. 1954
Northampton, The Meadow City. Northampton: Kneeland and Bryant, 1894
Northampton and the Northampton Institute for Savings, 1842-1942. Northampton: Metcalf Printing and Publishing Co. Inc. 1942
Trumble, James Russell. History of Northampton, Mass. from its settlement in 1654. Northampton: Press of Gazette Printing, 1902
Well, Daniel White and Ruben Field Wells. A History of Hatfield, Mass. 1660-1910. Springfield: F.C.H. Gibbons, 1910.

odd.head: General
odd.p: See also: Individual: George M. Roberts scrapbook 1878-1881
